quest.name: No Job Too Small
journal: Alphinaud is resisting the urge to pat himself on the back.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Though Bahamut is long gone, the internment hulks are far from safe.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It could be much worse, of course. They won't have to fight their way past Meracydian dragons, nor is there any danger the elder primal might be summoned again.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Even so, I daresay there are still a fair few Allagan creations and contraptions remaining to bar our friends' way. I only hope that Grandfather watches over them.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, I'm all for relying on the power of friendship, but we're now left with the rare luxury of having nothing to do. There must be something that requires our attention!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: First the Telophoroi, and now the Final Days. Heh─no one can accuse the Ilsabard contingent of backing down from a challenge!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Of course, they weren't all so committed to the cause when we first set out.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But after seeing the example set by you, Alphinaud, and the others, the change was palpable. They couldn't help but believe.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: What serendipitous irony that the remnants of the Seventh Umbral Calamity would become the keys to mankind's salvation. Never more certain have I been that Master Louisoix watcheth over us from the aetherial sea...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I'm confident that even the deadliest of Allagan defense mechanisms are no match for our allies.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: At this rate, some of them might soon have as many accomplishments to their names as a certain Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Time and time again, it seems that Allagan something-or-other are either the cause of or the solution to our problems.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hmm... To think the selfsame materials that once launched Dalamud will now be used to help ferry mankind to the moon. There's a poetry in that.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: ...Considering how much of a fuss he made at the time, I don't see why he takes every opportunity to bring it up. It was just firewood.

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: 'Preciate you doin' all this, but I ain't gettin' me hopes up just yet!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though our friends are searching for refined adamantite and sacred relics, we will only know if they meet your requirements once they have arrived.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: In the meantime, is there aught else we might do to be of service?

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: Ha! You've already done more than enough!

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: If I had to say, though, I could use someone who knows a thing or two about Allagan technology...

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: You there! The lad with the red eyes n' matchin' hair! You seem to know more than the average scholar!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ha! If only Master Kokkol knew how right he was. While he and G'raha establish a rapport, why don't we help with preparations for the great exodus?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Indeed, this would mean going above and beyond the terms of our arrangement─but I propose this not to curry favor.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As confident as I am that we will succeed, we must be ready for every eventuality. This would also be an opportunity to familiarize ourselves with the logistics of traversing the great expanse. And if nothing else, it beats twiddling our thumbs while we wait for the adamantite.

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: Well, ain't you a bunch of helpful buggers? If you've a mind to lend a hand, I know where you ought to go.

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: Sharlayan Hamlet is lousy with researchers and scholarly types, busyin' themselves preparin' for the exodus. Pah! That lot need all the help they can get!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well, then! Off we go!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I shall endeavor to provide Master Kokkol with whatever information he should require!

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: I'll admit, without refined adamantite, I ain't got a bloody clue how else I could get the aetherburner performin' any better! If you lot don't come up with the goods, we're buggered!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: In order to protect the secrets of the Central Circuit, the researchers must navigate a bewildering maze of paperwork before they are permitted to return to the surface.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I suppose it's no different than any other aspect of Sharlayan society. We do love our bureaucracy. It's very much a mirror of the city above, which is perhaps how it came to be called Sharlayan Hamlet.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As surprised as I was to learn the Forum planned to send everyone to the moon, I can't imagine how the commonfolk must feel about it.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Do my senses deceive me? In the shadow of yon corner...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Hmm. One can but hope this leadeth not to mischievous undertakings.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: What a quaint little settlement this is. A shame it is hidden underground.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I don't mind a bit of heavy lifting, but I draw the line at paperwork. So much as wave a sheaf of documents at me and I'll put my lance through it.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: From what I can tell, a lot of the people actually live down here.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I don't know how much help we can offer, but I daresay they'll benefit from some of that “fresh inspiration” Scholarch Montichaigne mentioned.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Let's start by asking around, ideally without getting in anyone's way!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let's meet by the aetheryte once our work is done.

dialogue.name: SILKENGRIN
dialogue.text: Oh, um, hullo. Are you one of the new helpers?

dialogue.name: SILKENGRIN
dialogue.text: Working on the aetherburner? Oh dear... I hear things have come to a standstill on that front.

dialogue.name: SILKENGRIN
dialogue.text: Even so, I'd choose that over my current duties. Checking and loading samples, day in, day out. It's tiring, thankless work...

dialogue.name: SILKENGRIN
dialogue.text: Still, no one'll be cross if I misplace a few legumes or what have you. The Forum's got enough on their plate as it is, what with deciding who gets to board the ark and when. Lot of powerful people have “opinions” about that.

dialogue.name: SILKENGRIN
dialogue.text: My heart goes out to Master Fourchenault and the others. Hardly get a moment's rest, I expect. Do they even have time to sleep?

dialogue.name: SILKENGRIN
dialogue.text: It's a race against time to prepare for the great exodus, but with everyone in such a rush, we're bound to make mistakes.

dialogue.name: STEADYCURRENT
dialogue.text: Helping with the ark? Even with all the power Master Kokkol's managed to squeeze out of the aetherburner, it's still not enough, apparently.

dialogue.name: STEADYCURRENT
dialogue.text: And now I hear the Final Days have arrived. Horrible creatures running rampant all over... <sigh> If only we'd begun the exodus sooner.

dialogue.name: STEADYCURRENT
dialogue.text: People are dying, and there'll be no end to it if we don't fulfill our duties.

dialogue.name: STEADYCURRENT
dialogue.text: But we will. We've spent years preparing for this moment. Believe in the plan, and all will be well.

dialogue.name: STEADYCURRENT
dialogue.text: If the aetherburner isn't up to snuff, we'll have to begin the exodus sooner than planned so we can make as many trips as possible.

dialogue.name: STEADYCURRENT
dialogue.text: Might fail to meet the projected targets, too. If so, we'll be faced with some hard choices about what to leave behind. And who...

dialogue.name: PAULTISANNE
dialogue.text: Offering to help? That's very kind, but I should be able to organize the rest of the documents by myself.

dialogue.name: PAULTISANNE
dialogue.text: It's mostly lists of the things we'll need once we arrive on the moon, and then whichever star we choose as our new home. My duties largely concern the maintenance of living conditions, so I'll be a lot busier after we depart.

dialogue.name: PAULTISANNE
dialogue.text: I hear that our lunar collaborators have come down to assist in our efforts. I'm looking forward to finally meeting them in person, after having communicated with them in such a limited capacity thus far.

dialogue.name: PAULTISANNE
dialogue.text: To be perfectly honest, I've not even the slightest idea what they look like! I do hope they're not enormous, looming giants... Why, I would much prefer something small and fluffy, like that behatted rabbit that ran by...

dialogue.name: PAULTISANNE
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, rabbits don't normally wear hats, do they? Or run on their back paws? Hmm... Perhaps it was an escaped sample.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Twould appear the Loporrits have infiltrated Sharlayan's most heavily guarded facility. How, I know not.

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Crikey! I wasn't expecting to see you here, Forename!

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: I'm sorry I didn't have a chance to say good-bye. And for, uh, having those other Loporrits attack you. Terrible misunderstanding, that.

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Not to worry, though, as all have since recovered from the rather savage beating you administered. They bear you no ill will! Well, perhaps a little, on account of the savagery, but time heals all wounds! Most, anyway.

dialogue.name: SINGINGWAY
dialogue.text:
Hum hum-hummm～♪
What joy to sample the delights of Etheirys!

dialogue.name: COOKINGWAY
dialogue.text: How marvelous it is to see you again! You'll be pleased to hear I've learned much since our fascinating discussion at the Carrotorium.

dialogue.name: COOKINGWAY
dialogue.text: It's all thanks to Urianger, you see. He's taught me the finer points of cooking, which, despite my name, I knew very little about. So many dishes, so many hard-to-pronounce words!

dialogue.name: COOKINGWAY
dialogue.text: Actually, I was rather hoping he'd show me how to bake an Archon loaf. They're quite popular, I hear, though it doesn't sound like it contains any flavor to speak of. Still, if that's the sort of thing your kind enjoys, I shall make enough to last the whole journey!

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Fancy meeting you here, Forename!

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Our friends in the Forum brought us to see their teeny-tiny toy boat, which was quite impressive considering they didn't use any creation magicks.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: What we're really interested in is Etheirys itself, though we now find ourselves in a sort of funny, underground, miniaturized version of it.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: We were hoping the Forum would give us a guided tour, but it appears they're rather preoccupied. Honestly! All that time to prepare, and they're still not ready!

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: I suppose we'll just have to show ourselves around. Or at least, that's what we were planning to do until we chanced upon Urianger and your good self!

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Since you're both dawdling about, engaging in idle chitchat, perhaps you could show us a few points of interest! Won't that be fun?

obj.n: The Case of the Missing Gleaner
